alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued March 03 at 9:51AM EST until March 04 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM EST THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...From 8 PM EST this evening through late tonight, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.0 feet, yards are flooded on Saint George Island, and water will begin covering the road leading to the island, especially if there is wave action. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two to two and a half feet above normal. The next two high tides at Piney Point are 11:38 AM and 12:15 AM. The next two high tides at Point Lookout are 11:18 AM and 10:48 PM. The next two high tides at Coltons Point are 12:14 PM and 12:51 AM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. St Marys River at Straits Point MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 03/11 AM 2.7 1.1 1.4 1.0 None 03/11 PM 3.4 1.8 2.2 3.0 Minor 04/11 AM 2.6 1.0 1.4 2.0 None 05/12 AM 2.1 0.5 0.9 1.0 None 05/12 PM 2.3 0.7 1.0 1.0 None 06/01 AM 2.6 1.0 1.3 0.5 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
